fee_codes.description: Duodenoscopy (not to be claimed if Z399 and/or Z400 performed on same patient within 3 months)
Subsequent procedure (within three months following previous endoscopic procedure)
endoscopic placement of stent in duodenum
Small bowel push enteroscopy
Endoscopy of ileostomy or colostomy, or reduction of obstructed Koch ileostomy
with biopsy
Confirmatory colonoscopy - sigmoid to descending colon

Absence of signs or symptoms, family history associated with an increased risk of malignancy (e.g. a first degree relative or at least two second degree relatives with colorectal cancer or a premalignant lesion) – sigmoid to descending colon
Five year follow up of normal colonoscopy (Z499), absence of intervening signs or symptoms - sigmoid to descending
Ten year follow up of normal colonoscopy (Z497, Z555), absence of intervening signs or symptoms - sigmoid to descending
Presence of signs or symptoms - sigmoid to descending colon
Hereditary (e.g. Familial adenomatous Polyposis or Hereditary Non-Polyposis Colorectal Cancer) or other bowel disorders (e.g. inflammatory bowel disease) associated with increased risk of malignancy
Follow up of abnormal colonoscopy - sigmoid to descending colon
Follow up of unsatisfactory colonoscopy
Follow up of incomplete polyp resection
Absence of signs or symptoms or risk factors, 50 years of age or older - sigmoid to descending colon

referenced_codes.description: rendered in association with duodenoscopy and small bowel push enteroscopy services is not eligible for payment unless the laryngoscopy service is rendered for suspicion of disease of the larynx.
Sigmoidoscopy (using 60 cm. flexible endoscope) is not eligible for payment with Z491, Z492, Z493, Z494, Z495, Z496, Z497, Z498, Z499 or Z555 same patient same day.
is not payable for anaesthesia services rendered for Z580.
is only eligible for payment for follow up of incomplete polyp resection.
is an uninsured service for the same patient in the five year period following Z499.
is an uninsured service for the same patient in the ten year period following Z497 and Z555.
is eligible for payment when rendered at the age and frequency of follow up in accordance with generally accepted clinical practice guidelines.
is eligible for payment for a colonoscopy rendered for the follow-up of a patient with a previous malignancy(ies) in accordance with current guidelines.
is only eligible for payment for a technically unsatisfactory colonoscopy due to poor preparation, failure to intubate the cecum or inability to complete the examination.
is an uninsured service for the same patient in the 10 year period following the previous Z555.
is not to be added to S181, S182, S185, S191, S192 or S193.
is not to be added to S181, S182, S185, S191, S192 or S193.
